Document.TEXT: Jefferies Group Reaffirms Buy Rating for Textron Inc. (TXT) Filed Under: Market News Textron Inc. (NYSE:TXT) ‘s stock had its buy rating restated by research analysts at Jefferies Group in a note issued to investors on Thursday, AnalystRatingsNetwork.com reports. Textron ( NYSE:TXT ) traded up 1.88% during trading on Thursday, reaching $34.22. The company's stock had a trading volume of 4,391,534 shares. The company's 50 day moving average price is $39.70 and its 200 day moving average price is $40.79. Textron has a 52 week low of $32.20 and a 52 week high of $46.93. The company has a market cap of $9.36 billion and a P/E ratio of 14.01. Textron (NYSE:TXT) last issued its earnings results on Wednesday, January 27th. The company reported $0.81 EPS for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of $0.83 by $0.02. The business had revenue of $3.92 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $4.23 billion. During the same period last year, the firm earned $0.76 EPS. The business's revenue was down 4.2% on a year-over-year basis. On average, equities analysts anticipate that Textron will post $2.87 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. In related news, VP Cheryl H. Johnson sold 2,121 shares of the company's stock in a transaction on Monday, November 2nd. The shares were sold at an average price of $42.37, for a total value of $89,866.77. Following the completion of the transaction, the vice president now directly owns 28,681 shares of the company's stock, valued at approximately $1,215,213.97. The sale was disclosed in a document filed with the SEC, which is available through the SEC website . Several other analysts have also recently commented on TXT. Zacks Investment Research cut shares of Textron from a hold rating to a sell rating in a research report on Wednesday, October 14th. Barclays dropped their target price on shares of Textron from $56.00 to $54.00 and set an overweight rating for the company in a research report on Wednesday, October 28th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. dropped their target price on shares of Textron to $50.00 and set a neutral rating for the company in a research report on Wednesday, October 28th. Cowen and Company reiterated an outperform rating and set a $53.00 target price (up previously from $52.00) on shares of Textron in a research report on Thursday, December 10th. Finally, Credit Suisse upped their target price on shares of Textron from $47.00 to $50.00 and gave the company an outperform rating in a research report on Monday, December 14th. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have assigned a hold rating, nine have assigned a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the stock. The company has a consensus rating of Buy and an average price target of $49.62. Other institutional investors recently made changes to their positions in the company. Sumitomo Mitsui Asset Management Company LTD raised its position in shares of Textron by 0.4% in the fourth quarter. Sumitomo Mitsui Asset Management Company LTD now owns 20,747 shares of the company's stock worth $871,000 after buying an additional 89 shares during the last quarter. FirstMerit Bank raised its position in shares of Textron by 2.5% in the fourth quarter. FirstMerit Bank now owns 8,200 shares of the company's stock worth $344,000 after buying an additional 200 shares during the last quarter. Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund raised its position in shares of Textron by 0.4% in the fourth quarter. Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund now owns 50,904 shares of the company's stock worth $2,138,000 after buying an additional 200 shares during the last quarter. Bank of The West raised its position in shares of Textron by 15.2% in the fourth quarter. Bank of The West now owns 23,292 shares of the company's stock worth $978,000 after buying an additional 3,069 shares during the last quarter. Finally, CIBC World Markets raised its position in shares of Textron by 63.0% in the fourth quarter. CIBC World Markets now owns 10,711 shares of the company's stock worth $450,000 after buying an additional 4,138 shares during the last quarter. Textron Inc. is a multi-industry company engaged in aircraft, defense, industrial and finance businesses to provide customers with products and services worldwide. It operates in five segments: Textron Aviation, Bell, Textron Systems, Industrial and Finance. Textron Aviation manufactures, sells and services Beechcraft and Cessna aircraft, and services the Hawker brand of business jets. Bell Helicopter is a supplier of military and commercial helicopters, tiltrotor aircraft, and related spare parts and services in the world. Textron Systems’ product lines consist of unmanned aircraft systems, marine and land systems, weapons and sensors, simulation, training and other defense and aviation mission support products and services. The Industrial segment designs and manufactures a range of products under three principal product lines. The Finance segment provides financing primarily to purchasers of new and pre-owned Textron Aviation aircraft and Bell helicopters.
